result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Seth J. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
3:14 PM - cases called - 22CF174 (Preliminary Hearing) and 22CF88 (tracking).  Defendant Seth J. Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney John Zich in court for Seth J. Johnson.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Officer Kurt Perra duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Polzin.  Defendant identified by Officer Perra.  State requests the Court take juridical notice of the bond in Lincoln County Case No. 22CF88.  Court notes take judicial notice.  Cross by Atty Zich.  Argument by Atty Zich.  Rebuttal by Atty Polzin.  Statement by the Court.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Bond will continue.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
